; 1235929775 5必须听见新的乡村歌曲：埃里克·教堂，卢卡斯·尼尔森，瓦莱丽六月及更多https://www.billboard.com/music/country/new-country-songs-eric-church-lukas-nelson-1235928505/Jessica Nicholson Mon, 24 Mar 2025 16:02:21 +0000 CountryMusicgenre countryMusic NewsNews https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235928505 This week's crop of new music also includes a new release from Jeannie Seely with Hannah Dasher and Tiera Kennedy.

本周的新音乐收藏中有一首来自埃里克·丘奇（Eric Church）的新曲目，埃里克·丘奇（Eric Church）创立了他即将发行的专辑Evangeline vs。该机器， 5月。 Jeannie Seely欢迎Hannah Dasher和Tiera Kennedy进行新的合作，而Lukas Nelson，Valerie June和Riley Roth提供了新音乐。

在Billboard在下面的本周最佳国家，Americana和Bluegrass歌曲中查看所有这些以及更多。

埃里克·教堂（Eric Church），“时间”

角，吉他，热情的合唱声音和埃里克·教堂（Eric Church）的标志性摇摆声音在教堂和踏板车Carusoe撰写的新版本中一起旋转。这首歌成为一首有力，摇滚的国歌，教会唱歌，转向简单的乐趣，尤其是音乐，以抵御过去几十年的影响。他唱歌：“我们还不像以前那样年轻，但是年轻的内心很容易/当你让一些吉他，单词和押韵处理时间时，”他唱歌，赞美包括克里斯·克里斯托夫森，汤姆·佩蒂和鲍勃·塞格在内的艺术家；很合适的是，滴答时钟的声音使这首歌缠住了。 “时间之手”来自教堂即将发行的新专辑Evangeline vs。这台机器，5月2日。

卢卡斯·尼尔森（Lukas Nelson），“未完成”

在2024年与他的长期乐队承诺分道扬promist之后，卢卡斯·纳尔逊（Lukas Nelson）从他即将发行的首张独奏专辑《美国浪漫史》（American Commance American Romance）中过渡到了他的第一次个人郊游，并于6月20日在索尼音乐纳什维尔（Sony Music Nashville）发行。由纳尔逊（Nelson）和亚伦·拉蒂尔（Aaron Raitiere）撰写，“未完成”拉回了艰苦的充电，全带的声音，选择了一个更加赤脚的声音，这是由小提琴板上的增强的。他以均匀的视角来研究生活的各种转变，这首歌似乎在某种程度上反映了他自己当前的音乐过渡季节。他唱歌说：“每天晚上的阳光/什么都没有持续，上帝都没有做到保证。”尽管在一个新的个人风险中，纳尔逊的新音乐仍然充满了他所闻名的有见地的歌曲创作和灰熊的声音。

瓦莱丽六月，“甜蜜的东西只是为你”

Valerie June与Norah Jones（支持人声）和制片人M. Ward一起，预览了她即将发行的专辑Owls，Omens和Oracles （4月11日在Concord Records上）。这条浪漫的曲目轻轻而直接地发现了六月唱歌，唱歌是关于吸收其他重要的光明和积极性的唱歌，并希望能反映对他们的爱和感情的反映。拔出吉他的弹力，这种甜蜜的真诚的感情，为六月即将到来的项目带来了迷人的瞥见。

Jeannie Seely，Hannah Dasher和Tiera Kennedy，“谁需要你”

“乡村灵魂小姐”珍妮·塞利（Jeannie Seely）在她58岁的职业生涯中曾在Grand Ole Opry上表演了超过5400次，与新一代乡村艺术家（Tiera Kennedy和Hannah Dasher）的团队在这款笨拙的后爆发后国歌中非常适合一个女孩的夜晚。由Seely撰写的“ Who Who Whoing You”的特点是三位艺人，他们沉思着100个防火威士忌，新的浪漫和一些休闲吸烟的时刻，都是返回前爱好者的首选替代品。 Seely的声音带来了一片坚韧不拔的智慧，Dasher的声音散发出甜美的声音，而Dasher则提供了幽默和机智。 “谁需要你”是Seely的一系列合作之一，包括与Mae Estes（“让我们聚在一起”）和Madeline Edwards（“任何知道爱是什么（会理解）”）。

莱利·罗斯（Riley Roth），“我们离开的地方”

莱利·罗斯（Riley Roth）发行了2024 Tiktok婚礼国歌“放开”之后，以情感的新歌为中心，以致敬，以致敬，以敬意。这些朋友通过伤心欲绝，生命枢纽以及许多试验和胜利来互相支持的岩石固定债券无法消失。这款甜美的感性曲目和搅动，起泡的乐器非常适合她柔和的对话声音。罗斯（Lauren McLamb）和凯尔·施林格（Kyle Schlienger）与罗斯（Roth）撰写了“我们关闭的地方”。

; 1235631744 广播巨头：Sway Calloway和Heather B在他们最喜欢的“早晨摇摆”采访中https://www.billboard.com/music/rb-hip-hop/sway-calloway-heather-b-forite-interviews-1235929785/Mackenzie Cummings-Grady Mon, 24 Mar 2025 15:54:31 +0000 MusicR&B/Hip-Hopgenre hiphopMusic NewsNews https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235929785 The SiriusXM radio hosts sat down with 广告牌进行独家采访，讲述一些出色的时刻。 ;

14多年来，早晨与Heather B和Tracy G的摇摆一直是流行文化中的单一固定装置。 Siriusxm广播节目由Sway Calloway ，Heather B. Gardner和Tracy Garraud主持，广播了几乎所有当今最大的图标的坦率采访。根据Sway和Heather的说法，与Billboard坐下来进行漫长的采访，这种热情好客的关键在于对艺术表达保持开放的态度。无论是说唱歌手，演员，奥运会运动员还是科技巨头，主持人都为能够为各行各业的人们提供认可。

这种开放性源于两位主人作为唱片艺术家的经历。 Sway在整个1990年代发行了少数独立专辑，其中包括与King Tech的混凝土丛林，这导致了Sway的第一场广播演出。与此同时，希瑟·B（Heather B）分别于1996年和2002年发行了专辑《 Takin's Mine and Evernal Eversects》的首次亮相。他们的背景帮助两个主持人了解了创意人能够进入热情的空间的重要性。

“我们每月有一次演出的伊恩·史密斯（Ian Smith）博士，谈论改善生活的方法，但随后您可能会将其翻转，并让Robert Glasper来进行一次果酱会议，Rapsody会来摇滚，” Sway告诉Billboard 。 “我一直是艺术家。我们的广播方式是通过艺术性的。这不仅是广播科学。”

; 1235929813 Larry Tamblyn, Co-Founder of 'Dirty Water' Garage Rockers the Standells Dies at 82 https://www.billboard.com/music/rock/larry-tamblyn-dead-dirty-water-standells-dies-obituary-1235929763/Gil Kaufman Mon, 24 Mar 2025 15:18:18 +0000 MusicRockgenre rockMusic Newsobituaryhttps://www.billboard.com/?p=1235929763 Tamblyn played keys and was the original lead singer of the L.A. band.

Larry Tamblyn, the keyboardist/singer and co-founder of LA garage rock band The Standells has died at 82. The news was first announced on Friday by Tamblyn's nephew Dennis and confirmed by the group's Facebook page . “Sad news to announce tonight,” the group wrote on Saturday in a message that did not provide any additional information on the cause of death.

“My uncle Larry Tamblyn passed away today. I have very fond memories of him and his family over the years,” Dennis wrote in the post that appears to have since been deleted. “He lived an incredible life. He was in a band called The Standells, whose hit song 'Dirty Water' is still played to this day whenever the Red Sox or the Bruins win a home game. They also played on an episode of The Munsters .”

According to People , the post continued, “A few years ago, The Standells played at Hotel Congress here in Tucson, Ariz., and Larry stayed with me. It was so great to hang out with him and catch up. He was still making music well into his later years. You will be missed, Uncle Larry.”

The Standells were formed in Los Angeles by Tamblyn — who had a brief solo career in the early 1960s — along with guitarist Tony Valentino, bassist Jody Rich and drummer Benny King. Their debut single, “You'll Be Mine Someday Gir/ Girl in My Heart” was released in 1963 under the name Larry Tamblyn and the Standels before they signed to the Liberty label and adopting their foreshortened name, with Gary Lane taking Rich's place and Gary Leeds replacing King; Leeds left a short time later and was replaced by former Mouseketeer Dick Dodd, who also took over as lead vocalist.

The band's first album, the mostly covers collection In Person at PJs , came out in 1964 and the group famously made a cameo on The Munsters sitcom in 1965, where they played the original “Come On and Ringo” and a cover of the Beatles' “I Want to Hold Your Hand.” Though the group was originally formed by Tamblyn, he did not sing the lead vocals on what is the band's most enduring hit, 1966's Billboard Hot 100 No. 11 garage rock classic “Dirty Water.”

“Dirty Water” became the band's calling card, acting as one of the anchors of both the 1972 Nuggets garage rock compilation as well as a sports anthem for a number of Boston-area professional teams, serving as the victory song at Red Sox, Bruins and Celtics games. The track, anchored by Dodd's snarly vocals and a metronomic beat, became associated with Boston thanks to lyrics referencing the polluted Charles River, the Boston Strangler and shout outs to the city and its “lovers, muggers and thieves.” The Standells performed the song at Fenway Park during one of the Red Sox's 2004 World Series games.

The song appeared on the band's 1966 debut album, Dirty Water , which also featured covers of the Rolling Stones' “19th Nervous Breakdown” and other originals written by “Dirty Water” producer/songwriter Ed Cobb (The Four Preps).

Though the group never again scored a hit on the level with the lascivious, grungy “Dirty Water” they did land at No. 43 with their follow-up single, “Sometimes Good Guys Don't Wear White.” A second album, Why Pick on Me – Sometimes Good Guys Don't Wear White , was released in 1966 while the group's roster underwent another series of personnel changes before 1967's The Hot Ones! cover songs album. Dodd — who died in 2013 — left in 1968 to go solo.

The Standells released two more albums, 1967's Try It and 2013's Bump , and continued on performing sporadically in the 1980s and 90s with a line-up featuring Tamblyn and a variety of former and new band members.

Tamblyn was not the only A-lister in his family. He was the brother of actor Russ Tamblyn ( West Side Story ) and uncle of actress Amber Tamblyn ( Paint It Black ). In addition to his work with the group, Tamblyn released an autobiography, From Squeaky Clean to Dirty Water : My Life with Sixties Garage Rock Trailblazers the Standells , in 2022. Tamblyn was inducted into the California Music Hall of Fame in 2013 by brother Russ.
